revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{suffix|en|yellow|ly}} ===Adverb=== {{en-adv}} # In a [[yellow]] manner; with yellow colour. #* '''1864''', Henry T. Spicer, “Mrs. Lirriper’s Legacy: Another Past Lodger Relates What Lot He Drew at Glumper House”, in ''{{w|All the Year Round}}'', Extra Christmas Number, 1 December, 1864, Part 4, p. 28,<sup>[https://archive.org/details/mrslirriperslega64dickrich]</sup> #*: After rice appeared the much-dreaded pie, glaring '''yellowly''', with its coarse pretentious outside—prototype of many a living humbug—veiling one knows not what of false and vile. #* '''1930''', {{w|D. H. Lawrence}}, “Love Among the Haystacks” in ''Love Among the Haystacks and Other Stories'', Part 4, p. 31,<sup>[https://archive.org/details/loveamonghaystac00lawr]</sup> #*: The light of the bicycle lamp sheered '''yellowly''' across the dark, catching a glint of raindrops, a mist of darkness, shadow of leaves and strokes of long grass. #* '''1938''', {{w|Graham Greene}}, ''{{w|Brighton Rock (novel)|Brighton Rock}}'', London: Vintage, 2002, Chapter 1, #*: He showed his tartar-coated teeth in a fatherly smile. {{...}} when he crossed the room, '''yellowly''' smiling, he might have been about to kiss the bride. #* '''1958''', {{w|Alfred Hayes}}, ''My Face for the World to See'', New York Review of Books, 2013, Chapter 6, p. 19,<sup>[https://books.google.ca/books?id=llq4Nd5UjrgC&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false]</sup> #*: She had a black cat. It regarded me '''yellowly''' through the window screen when I rang her doorbell.
